meanings.definition: (adj.) (of a disease) prevalent over a whole country or the world.
meanings.sent1: The pandemic flu spread quickly across the entire world.
meanings.sent2: The COVID-19 pandemic affected people in many countries.
meanings.sent3: The pandemic outbreak of sneezing teddy bears was both funny and alarming.
meanings.sent4: The pandemic of kindness swept through the school, touching every student.
meanings.sent5: The pandemic storm flooded the entire city with rain and wind.

meanings.definition: (n.) an outbreak of a disease that occurs over a wide geographic area and affects an exceptionally high proportion of the population.
meanings.sent1: The pandemic of measles spread rapidly throughout the region.
meanings.sent2: The Spanish flu pandemic in 1918 was one of the deadliest in history.
meanings.sent3: The pandemic of missing socks in the laundry was a mystery to everyone.
meanings.sent4: The pandemic of laughter echoed through the school as the joke spread.
meanings.sent5: The pandemic of excitement filled the stadium as the home team won the championship.
